text: my name is randy button i'm the general
manager of the aws data sync service so
what's exciting about data sync is that
we are one of the very first services
many customers use when they come to aws
one of the first things you need to do
is move your data and that's where data
sync plays so we have great exposure we
have the honor of being one of the first
services that really set the tone and
user experience for our customers so as
the general manager i lead of a team of
around 30 principally comprised of
development engineers and product
managers we set the strategy for data
sync we own and run the service and
operate it working with customers and
our field partners to define features
that bring the most value aws gives you
the freedom and the flexibility and
autonomy to really impact and affect
change so i'm able to leverage
everything i've learned to bring value
to aws and they welcome and encourage
that i describe aws as a collection of
startups if you think about each service
that's the level of autonomy that we're
given
which i think really speaks to how
quickly aws is able to grow by giving
that creative freedom to all these
various services and allow them to do
what they do best
what i often highlight when people ask
me about working at aws is the fact that
we are focused on developing products
for customers and as an engineer that's
what you want time to do you're in your
code you're surrounded by experts truly
a world-class collection of engineers
around you supported with world-class
tools if you're an engineer you want to
code you want to be using the best tools
and you want to respect and learn from
your peers aws offers
[Music]
